Description: Blue-green glazed composition vase with circular foot, convex body, cylindrical neck and everted rim, exterior decorated with five relief friezes: 1 - floral motifs; 2 - quadrupeds (bulls, lions and deer); 3 - fish and fruit; 4 - garland; 5 - around neck - birds and floral motifs.
Curator's comments: Cf. Brooklyn Museum of Art, Charles Edwin Wilbour Fund 70.89.3 (h 17.0 cm)=Cat. Cleveland 1998, no. 141.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2004 10 Jul-4 Sept, Bolton Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2004 18 Sept-14 Nov, Salford Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2004-2005 27 Nov-23 Jan, Chester, Grosvenor Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2005 5 Feb-28 May, Warrington Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2005 18 Jun-18 Sept, Rochdale Art Gallery, Beasts of the Nile 2005 26 Sept-2 Dec, Preston, Museum of Lancashire, Beasts of the Nile 2006 14 Jan-22 Apr, Lancaster City Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2006 9 May-6 Aug, Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire Museum, Beasts of the Nile 2006 14 Aug-19 Nov, Swansea Museum, Beasts of the Nile
